prompt: Please generate an operative report for a 63 year old male referred by Dr. Chen. We did a trach bronch for respiratory failure. Airway showed necrotic tissue. We aspirated mucus from Left Carina (LC2), Carina, LLL Basal Segments etc. Also checked the left mainstem stent, it was lavaged.
completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: Dr. Chen

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 63-year-old male who presents with difficulty clearing secretions.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J96.90 Respiratory Failure 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J96.90 Respiratory Failure 

PROCEDURE

31615 Visualization of windpipe (Tracheobronchoscopy through established tracheostomy incision) 

31646 Therapeutic aspiration subsequent episodes 

ATTENDING Dr. M. Gonzales

ASSISTANT PA-C J. Doe

SUPPORT STAFF RN: David K. RT: Lisa M.

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope 

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection The airway was inspected via the tracheostomy tube. Lidocaine was applied to the airway.

The airway anatomy demonstrated stable airway anatomy with minimal necrotic debris.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the following segments from mucus and mucus plug: 

Left Carina (LC2)

Carina

LLL Basal Segments

RLL Basal Segments

Bronchus Intermedius

Trachea (Middle 1/3)

Trachea (Distal 1/3)

Secretions were cleared.

Stent Maintenance The left mainstem stent was heavily encrusted with secretions; extensive lavage required.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMENS

None 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

[REDACTED] is a 63-year-old male who presents for bronchoscopy for respiratory failure.

Follow up bronchoscopy in 2-3 weeks.

prompt: 71yo F trach bronch. Dr. Chen. J96.90. suctioned mucus 8 segments. left mainstem stent cleaned. airway had granulation/secretions. no comps.
completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: Dr. Chen

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 71-year-old female who presents with worsening hypoxia.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J96.90 Respiratory Failure 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J96.90 Respiratory Failure 

PROCEDURE

31615 Visualization of windpipe (Tracheobronchoscopy through established tracheostomy incision) 

31646 Therapeutic aspiration subsequent episodes 

ATTENDING Dr. K. Lee

ASSISTANT Dr. L. Davis

SUPPORT STAFF RN: Sarah J. RT: Amanda G.

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope 

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection The airway was inspected via the tracheostomy tube. Lidocaine was applied to the airway.

The airway anatomy demonstrated significant granulation tissue at the distal tip.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the following segments from mucus and mucus plug: 

Left Mainstem

LLL Basal Segments

Trachea (Middle 1/3)

Carina

Trachea (Distal 1/3)

LUL Lingula Carina (Lc1)

Left Carina (LC2)

RLL Basal Segments

Secretions were cleared.

Stent Maintenance The left mainstem stent was partially occluded with mucus; this was rinsed with saline and cleaned.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMENS

None 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

[REDACTED] is a 71-year-old female who presents for bronchoscopy for respiratory failure.

Follow up bronchoscopy in 1 week.

prompt: Codes 31615, 31646. Dx J96.90 Respiratory Failure. Pt 67 M. Attending Dr. K. Lee. Procedure: Tracheobronchoscopy, aspiration of secretions (Bronchus Intermedius, Trachea (Distal 1/3), Left Mainstem etc), left mainstem stent maintenance.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope 

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection The airway was inspected via the tracheostomy tube. Lidocaine was applied to the airway.

The airway anatomy demonstrated mild inflammation with white fibrinous debris.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the following segments from mucus and mucus plug: 

Left Carina (LC2)

Trachea (Middle 1/3)

Trachea (Proximal 1/3)

RML Carina (RC2)

Bronchus Intermedius

Secretions were cleared.

Stent Maintenance The left upper lobe stent was in good position with no significant obstruction.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
